info.title: Change Management
info.description: This is Swagger UI environment generated for the TMF Change Management specification

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

ChangeRequest.description:
Change Request is a type of request which can be used for the management and control of Change Management 
process between a customer and a service provider or between a service provider and a partner and vice versa.

actualEndTime.description:
Date and time when the change implementation is finished 
actually.

actualStartTime.description: Date and time when the change implementation is started actually.

budget.description: The budget reserved for the change.

channel.description: A channel represents the way the Change Request was created

completionDate.description:
Date and time when the change request is confirmed to be 
completed

currency.description: The used currency related with cost

externalId.description:
ID given by the requestor to facilitate the relationship set up and 
searches afterwards)

href.description: Hyperlink to access a change request

id.description:
Identifier of a Change Request, it is created on repository side 
(Change Management system).

impact.description: Indicates how about the impact by this change

plannedEndTime.description:
Date and time when the change implementation is planned to be 
finished.

plannedStartTime.description:
Date and time when the change implementation is planned to be 
started.

priority.description: A way that can be used by consumers to prioritize change request in Change Management system

requestDate.description: Date and time when the change request is raised

requestType.description: Indicates the type of the change request.

risk.description: The risk to implement this change request.

riskValue.description: The additional cost if the risk will happen.

scheduledDate.description: Date and time that the schedule is made.

status.description: Status of the change request and it¡¯s a sub-state.

attachment.description: The attachments of the communication message (when it is email type).

relatedParty.description: The parties involved by the change request

relatedChangeRequest.description: An existing Change Request that has some form of correlation with the given Change Request.

location.description: The place at which the change request occurred.

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing a resource (for type extension).

@baseType.description: The base type for use in polymorphic collections

Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: The mime type of the document as defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046 specifications.

path.description: The path of the attached file

size.description: The size of the file (sizeUnit if present indicates the unit, otherwise kilobytes is the default).

sizeUnit.description: The unit size for expressing the size of the file (MB,kB...)

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: Period of validity of the attachment

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing a resource (for type extension).

@baseType.description: The base type for use in polymorphic collections

WorkLog.description: A record of the work performed on the change request during the investigation and resolution process.

createDateTime.description: Date and time of worklog generated.

lastUpdateDateTime.description: Date and time when the worklog updated.

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

Incident.description:
An Incident is a record of an event that has altered the operational state of a entity (Resource, Service or Customer's 
Product).

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

ChangeRequestSpecification.description: Defines a set of attributes related to Change Request.

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

ImpactEntityRef.description:
Defines the entities (product, service, resource, and other related objects) which will be impacted while the change 
request is executed.

description.description: Description and analysis of the impact of the change request on the Product, Service or Resource.

href.description: Hyperlink to access the impacted party, it could be a party reference or a party role reference.

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

ChangeRequestCharacteristic.description: Characteristics of the change request to instantiate or to modify

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing a resource (for type extension).

TargetEntityRef.description: The entity which will be changed or configured while the change request is executed.

description.description: The description to the related party.

href.description: Hyperlink to access the target entity.

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

RelatedPartyRef.description: RelatedParty reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

href.description: Reference of the related party, could be a party reference or a party role reference

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

Resolution.description: The way one or more change request has been implementation through a direct remedy or task.

code.description:
The resolution's code, it can be configured as a multiple level 
hierarchy.

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

SLARef.description: ServiceLevelAgreement reference: A service level agreement (SLA) is a type of agreement that represents a formal negotiated agreement between two parties designed to create a common understanding about products, services, priorities, responsibilities, and so forth. The SLA is a set of appropriate procedures and targets formally or informally agreed between parties in order to achieve and maintain specified Quality of Service.

href.description: Reference of the service level agreement

id.description: Unique identifier of service level agreement

name.description: Name of the service level agreement

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

ChangeRequestRef.description: An existing Change Request that has some form of correlation with the given Change Request.

correlation.description: The correlation between two change requests

href.description: Hyper link to access a change request.

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.
The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

Note.description: Extra information about a given entity

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

href.description: The detail address of the location.

id.description: The post code of an address.

role.description: The role of the place (e.g. delivery address, install site etc).

TimePeriod.description: A base / value business entity used to represent a period of time between two timepoints.

endDateTime.description: An instant of time, ending at the TimePeriod.

startDateTime.description: An instant of time, starting at the TimePeriod

dateTime.description: The date time that a record is generated.

description.description: The detail description in a record.

supportPerson.description: The person who logged that record.

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

Task.description: A step or task along in the process of implementation a Change Request.

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

reason.description: Text that explains the reason for error.

message.description: (optional) Text that provide more details and corrective actions related to the error.

referenceError.description: (optional) A URL to online documentation that provides more information about the error.

@type.description: (optional) The class type of a REST resource.

@schemaLocation.description: (optional) A link to the schema describing a REST resource.
